column4: Zambezi -> what is an ASUS P5Q-E? is that some kind of special mobo? 64bit?
It's a motherboard S775. Here: http://linuxrevolution.blogspot.com/2008/09/ubuntu-and-asus-p5q-e-motherboard.html That didn't help.

I'm installing from a IDE/PATA DVD to a IDE/PATA HDD, but it just won't work and when I tried to install from USB-memory it didn't find DVD or any drives (I connected an extra SATA2-drive to see what happened).
I'm installing from a CD-medium, but in a DVD-drive. More clear?
It's the Server edition. I'm not going to install X on it at all.
I'm going to try Fedora now. I read on Asus homepage their kernel fixed the bug. The most important thing now is to see everything works fine. The Fedora goes bye bye.
